ImprovementType.Description: A competition of reason, deduction, and technology. Boosts research in every city +5%.
Apiaries reduce the Unrest for your entire faction.

Armorers reduce the costs of adding armor to units trained in this city while also increasing their base Armor. Beware - as a Republic, you must pay the full cost of this infrastructure, meaning food, gold, and increased public disapproval of your military expansion.

GameModifier.Provides: Trained units cost -1.5 gold per Season in upkeep

ImprovementType.Description: Bakeries increase the amount of Food a faction gets from Grain tile yields.

GameModifier.Provides: +10 Food per Grain for your Faction

ImprovementType.Description: Barracks decrease the training time for units trained in this city while also increasing their Accuracy. Beware - as a Republic, you must pay the full cost of this infrastructure, meaning food, gold, and increased public disapproval of your military expansion.
Magistrate Towers keep a city running in an orderly manner by lowering Unrest.

Blacksmiths increase the base Armor of every unit trained in a city. Beware - as a Republic, you must pay the full cost of this infrastructure, meaning food, gold, and increased public disapproval of your military expansion.

GameModifier.Provides: Trained units cost -1 gold per Season in upkeep

ImprovementType.Description: The Brewery will greatly increase the amount of Food a faction gets from Grain tile yields.

GameModifier.Provides: +40 Food per Grain for your faction

ImprovementType.Description: Republic butchers salt-pack meat and provide expert stew and meat-bread recipes, greatly increasing the amount of Food a faction gets from Grain tile yields.

GameModifier.Provides: +20 Food per Grain for your faction

ImprovementType.Description: This court gives your local populace the means to resolve disputes non-violently and without getting the local Senator's administration involved. Peer-juries pass verdicts, and the court's rulings can be recognized by the Senate, in the case of appeals.

This court gives your local populace the means to resolve disputes non-violently and without getting the local Senator's administration involved. Peer-juries pass verdicts, and the court's rulings can be recognized by the Senate, in the case of appeals.
Clay Quarries can be built on Clay Pits to add a Material to the attached city.

Command Posts improve the training of units, causing them to take less time to train and providing them with a number of bonuses. Beware - the people see a Command Post and its upgrades as not simply necessary defense, but the encroachment of a military state upon their civil society.
A news press run by laborers and farmers, it keeps your citizens aware of the Senate's activities and invested in the society.
A news press run by laborers and farmers, it keeps your citizens aware of the Senate's activities and invested in the society.
This post extends the Republic's letter-carrying service into this city, boosting its economy and quelling unrest by informing the people of the activites of Senators in other city-states.

This post extends the Republic's letter-carrying service into this city, boosting its economy and quelling unrest by informing the people of the activites of Senators in other city-states. By building a network of these posts, your republican society will more easily tolerate growing larger.
Crystal Mines upgrade from Crystal Quarries. They provide you with additional Crystal every Season.
Crystal Quarrys can be built on Crystal Deposits. They provide you with Crystal every Season.
Crystal Troves upgrade from Crystal Mines. They provide you with additional Crystal every Season.
Docks are upgraded from Piers. They increase Gildar and Food in cities they are constructed in.

A gathering of laborers, farmers, and merchants that barter and make offers to match surplus with demand. This exchange gives price signals to your Labor's economy, increasing efficiency and reducing waste.

A gathering of laborers, farmers, and merchants that barter and make offers to match surplus with demand. This exchange gives price signals to your Labor's economy, increasing efficiency and reducing waste.
A more organized connection between local exchanges, this guild allows the price signals of each city to reach every city, making your economy more self-aware and efficient.

GameModifier.Provides: +2 Production per Material in all your cities
+15 Food per Grain for your faction

ImprovementType.Description: Farms can be built on Wild Grain. They provide additional Grain yields for a city.

Forges improve the defense of units trained in a city. Beware - as a Republic, you must pay the full cost of this infrastructure, meaning food, gold, and increased public disapproval of your military expansion.

GameModifier.Provides: Trained units cost -0.5 gold per Season in upkeep

ImprovementType.Description: Foundries upgrade from Smelters. They provide you with additional Metal every Season.
Gardens provide food for the people, increasing the amount of Food provided by Grain yield in cities they are built in.
Granaries greatly increase the amount of food gathered from each Grain yield in a city.
Gold Mines can be built on Gold Deposits. They produce Gildar every Season.
Grocers increase the amount of food cities gain from Grain yields across the nation.

GameModifier.Provides: +5 Food per Grain for your Faction

ImprovementType.Description: Harbors are upgraded from Docks. They increase Gildar and Food in cities they are constructed in.
Merchant Banks allow the nation to gain interest on all Gildar it has saved up.
Iron Mines can be built on Iron Ore. They provide Metal every Season.
Irrigated Farms upgrade from Farms. Expert crop rotation provide amazing long-term yields for a city.
Contests of efficiency and production quality between craftsmen, artisans, and farmer drives efficiency, and new economic discovery.

GameModifier.Provides: +1 Production per Material in all your cities
+5 Food per Grain for your faction

ImprovementType.Description: Competing parties of labor meet here, seeking to place workers where needed and negotiate with Senators seeking new laws. Ultimately this improves the quality of life for your labor force, and the wealth of your society.

GameModifier.Provides: +2 Production per Material in all your cities

ImprovementType.Description: Logging Camps provide additional Production per Material yield. They can only be built on forests.
Lumber Yards upgrade from Logging Camps. They provide additional Production per Material yield.
Markets provide additional Gildar every Season in cities they are built in.
Masons improve the production and construction efficiency of cities they are built in.
Merchants are a great source of additional Gildar.
Mills improve the production and construction efficiency of cities they are built in.

An bank for labor pensions, as well as a credit union for farmers and mills. The pension guild ensures that pension promises for career labor are met, and helps credit flow to your production economy. This strengthens the social contract, and encourages harder work.

GameModifier.Provides: +2 Production per Material in all your cities

ImprovementType.Description: A guild of reporters who anazlyze and report on what is happening in the Republic, aggregating reports from the local presses. The Senators would rather they took some gildar and kept quiet, but your people appreciate the agendas of Senators being put into daylight. So much shared information also boosts your whole Republic's trade and research.
Orchards can be built on Fruit Groves. They provide additional Grain yields for a city.
Pastures can be built on Wild Game and increase the Hit Points of your units.
Piers can only be built on rivers. They increase Food in cities they are constructed in.

The true heart of the city. Citizens can gather here to barter, haggle, and discuss politics. But most of all, ideas flow freely and dissenting thoughts are given voice. Over time, the public forum will give this city the massive benefits - and problems - of a Republic.

A network of plumbing that allows human excrement to be hygenically removed from the denser population centers. Increases growth and allows for denser populations, which in turn makes food distribution more efficient.

A network of plumbing that allows human excrement to be hygenically removed from the denser population centers. Increases growth and allows for denser populations, which in turn makes food distribution more efficient.

The men who meet here come from across the realm, under psedonyms and disguise. They know the dangers of knowledge - typified in the Titans and Morrigan The Mad - yet its benefit to all when applied, with discretion. Some things, the populace is not meant to know.

GameModifier.Provides: +2 XP per Season for Stationed Champions

ImprovementType.Description: Build meeting chambers for your senate, proving your Republic's commitment to non-centralized rule. The host city will see reduced -20 unrest and increased growth, but all cities will receive -10% unrest.
Smelters upgrade from Iron Mines. They provide you with additional Metal every Season.
Stables can be built on Wild Horses. They provide you with a Horse every 5 seasons.
By storing your harvest, and encouraging crop rotation and superior agricultural science, Storehouses will allow your farmers to produce much more Food for each of your Grain yields.
Tax Offices increase the Gildar production of any city they are constructed in. But it will increase local unrest by 3%, so choose wisely when you build it.
Timber Mills upgrade from Lumber Yards. They provide additional Production per Material yield.
The Senator's Hall will increase the borders of a city and reduce its Unrest level.
A school not for aristocrats or academics, but the common laborer, that he might find gainful employment and be a fully productive citizen.
A school not for aristocrats or academics, but the common laborer, that he might find gainful employment and be a fully productive citizen.

Training Yards increase the Accuracy of all units trained in a city while reducing their training costs. Beware - as a Republic, the state must pay the full cost of this infrastructure, in the form of food and pay for military staff. Also, there will be increased public disapproval of your military expansion.
Warg Dens can be built on Wild Wargs. They provide a Warg every 5 seasons.
Watermills are upgraded from Harbors. They increase Gildar, Production and Food in cities they are constructed in.

The Weaponsmith provides Attack and Defense bonuses for all trained units in a city while also greatly reducing their production costs. Beware - as a Republic, you must pay the full cost of this infrastructure, meaning food, gold, and increased public disapproval of your military expansion.

GameModifier.Provides: Trained units cost -2.5 gold per Season in upkeep

ImprovementType.Description: Workshops boost the Production a city gets from its Material yields.
